010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * This is an implementation of the global "minimum error" thresholder proposed
016 * by Kittler and Illingworth in [1]. See Sec. 9.1.6 (Alg. 9.6) of [2] for a
017 * detailed description.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] J. Illingworth and J. Kittler. "Minimum error thresholding". Pattern
021 * Recognition 19(1), 41â€“47 (1986). <br>
022 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/08/01
028 */
029public class MinErrorThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
030        
031        static final double EPSILON = 1E-12;
032        
033        private double[] S2_0, S2_1;
034        private int N;
035        
036        public MinErrorThresholder() {
037                super();
038        }
039        
040        @Override
041        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
042                int K = h.length;
043                makeSigmaTables(h);     // set up S2_0, S2_1, N
044
045                int n0 = 0, n1;
046                int qMin = -1;
047                double eMin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
048                for (int q = 0; q <= K-2; q++) {
049                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
050                        n1 = N - n0;
051                        if (n0 > 0 && n1 > 0) { 
052                                double P0 = (double) n0 / N;    // could use n0, n1 instead
053                                double P1 = (double) n1 / N;
054                                double e = // 1.0 + 
055                                        P0 * Math.log(S2_0[q]) + P1 * Math.log(S2_1[q])
056                                        - 2 * (P0 * Math.log(P0) + P1 * Math.log(P1));
057                                if (e < eMin) {         // minimize e;
058                                        eMin = e;
059                                        qMin = q;
060                                }
061                        }
062                }
063                return qMin; 
064        }
065        
066        private void makeSigmaTables(int[] h) {
067                int K = h.length;
068                final double unitVar = 1d/12;   // variance of a uniform distribution in unit interval
069                S2_0 = new double[K];
070                S2_1 = new double[K];
071                
072                int n0 = 0;
073                long A0 = 0;
074                long B0 = 0; 
075                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
076                        long ql = q;    // need a long type to avoid overflows
077                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
078                        A0 = A0 + h[q] * ql;
079                        B0 = B0 + h[q] * ql*ql;
080                        S2_0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? 
081                                        unitVar + (B0 - (double)A0*A0/n0)/n0 : 0;       
082                }
083                
084                N = n0;
085                
086                int n1 = 0;
087                long A1 = 0;
088                long B1 = 0; 
089                S2_1[K-1] = 0;
090                for (int q = K-2; q >= 0; q--) {
091                        long qp1 = q+1;
092                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
093                        A1 = A1 + h[q+1] * qp1;
094                        B1 = B1 + h[q+1] * qp1*qp1;
095                        S2_1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? 
096                                        unitVar + (B1 - (double)A1*A1/n1)/n1 : 0;
097                }
098        }
099        
100}
